title: AFK'ers cost whole team LP.
body:
We hate it when we get an AFKer in our games. It happens to everyone. Ranked games is the worst, too! So why does everyone get punished because of it? Yeah the afker might get a time penalty, but why does the rest of the team lose LP, for something out of their control. Those on the AFK team should get 0 LP, while the winning team get the standard LP, meanwhile the AFKer cops a 200% LP deficit. 


#Thoughts?

replies.body:
Yea, getting afk's in a ranked game can be very painful I do agree with you however Riot has done what they can to try and prevent this from happening.

For example the remake system that got introduced helps when people go afk or don't connect within the first few minutes of the game which I personally have been able to use to avoid many frustrating 4v5s.

The painful thing is though that later into the game it is hard for Riot to implement a system against afks that work correctly. The idea that you stated is good in the theory of it will work for making it so that I'd there is an afk you won't get punished for something out of your control. However it leads to the possibility of if there is a game you can't win someone you are queued with potentially taking the leave penalty so that the rest of the team doesn't lose LP and the enemy team doesn't get any.

This could pose a serious threat to the intergerty of the competition of the game especially at high elos where there are fewer players. This becomes even more of a problem when you think about flex queue as well having up to all 5 players potentially queued with you. 

All up though make sure that you report people who afk on your team as the system will punish them for it. If people afk in games they will start getting bans and if they do it enough or consistently it won't be long before they get a long term ban or potentially permaed.

I hope this helps explain why the system is the way how it is however if you get any ideas about how you think this can be fixed with ideas such as the one you brought up, make sure you make a post about it detailing your idea to add to the system. Riot are always looking for constructive ways to improve their game and the boards is a good way to communicate with them to help combat things such as AFKs in games.

Good luck in your games.

~Elam

because its hard to determine if the person just sits on the fountain making sure the leaver buster doesnt detect them.

This kind of thing is easily taken advantage of too. Especially with smurfs and flex que.

"oh hey we are losing, someone AFK so only you lose LP"

It does suck, i have had more problems with AFK's and general poor behaviour this season then all of last season already it feels like. But there isn't much you can do other than report and move on.

/remake is broken

just 3 games ago as support the ezreal on my team lost internet. Not his fault.

Desperate to avoid lp loss he rushed back to the game just before we could remake.

The other team took advantage and got first tower BEFORE ez could get to lane

note L first tower has a 70% chance of winning the game
They then rotated mid took that. rotated top took that.
took drakes. 

by 10min!!!! we were so far behind it was gg with no chance at all.

Not working as intended because the game can be snowballed so easily in this meta

Triple demerits should apply to afkers.

let them drop an entire division for leaving a game that results in a loss.

I'm sure that the employees at Riot have been looking into methods to compensate for this sort of behaviour, I agree with Elam on the basis that they've come up with the remake method which does indeed punish the person that is AFK while not punishing yourself.
People generally go AFK because there wasn't enough cooperation within the team, either they get flamed or they start flaming someone else and that leads between a broken bond between both players, the easiest way to prevent this is to not insult each other.

In saying this, you already have 5 enemies that game, creating an additional on your own team does not increase your chances of winning. But also AFKing isn't as simple as leaving the game, there are genuine cases where people do not rage quit, this can be taken to the extent that your team mates don't know the full story and can report them for being AFK. I'm talking about cases such as people genuinely are trying to play but their internet or computer simply will not allow them to play due to latency or hardware issues. This brings me to BarryButcher's point; this can definitely be abused from smurfs or a team mate in flex queue, but regarding premades I believe they'd do the exact same thing the did in higher ELO with smurfs, if you're premade with the person you also take the penalty.
This ensures that the system isn't being abused too heavily, but also it still would be.

Anyway, that's my thoughts on the topic
-Threat
